issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
If user enters very long name without any spaces for security group or key pair UI's layout is broken. See attached screen shot.
I think we have to limit those names in table view to 30-50 characters and show them as 'StartOfTheName...'.
fields.summary: Long names entered by use breaks UI layout

comments.body: I think adopting a "..." notation and truncating strings would be appropriate.
To Jenny for comment on how to display long strings in UI

yes, agreed. this should be this way for all columns. We should have the data not push the column width wider but stay withint he column width, and hide what spill over. If they want to see it all they should widen the column, which should not widen the overall table. Is this a CSS thing that Dave can fix?

Jenny,
What do you mean by 'user should widen column'? I don't think we support this functionality. I am suggesting to show "First X chars ..." in the name. This way we know for sure that we can support long names in tables. We also need to think what to do in edit and delete dialogs. Currently long name stretches dialogs and this is not ideal. I think we need to add artificial line breaks/spaces into verylongandunrealnames.

Yeah, that is what I was afraid of. Most tables support adjusting the width
manually, but I didn't know if jquery tables support that. If not, we will
have to truncate somehow.

Can you double-check to be sure jquery tables don't support this? if not,
we should truncate to a reasonable length that displays int he tables, and
add tooltips to them in the landings and the edit/delete dialogs (and
wherever else) that show the full name when you mouse over a truncated
name...

On Tue, Oct 16, 2012 at 3:40 PM, Vasiliy Kochergin (JIRA) <

OK to truncate with ellipses in table and have full value display in tooltip on hover. reassign to developer to fix.

Jenny,
Do you want to use tooltips for onelinelongword only of for all multi-lines descriptions/names. How about adding new lines into onelinelongword so it can be displayed on UI?

Jenny,
If we are doing ... plus tooltip on table view. Should it work the same on delete dialog?

Hi Vasya,

Yes please use it on the delete dialogs if there is not enough room there either. We have more room there and so should be able to show more of the long names before we have to truncate (two columns of info instead of a lot more)...can you ping me on IRC when you come online so you can show me specifically all the places you are seeing these and we can have a comprehensive look? Thanks!
Fixed in 5cc628c50e67c14f189cdcbb90bbb83cec4487a0

I don't know what version of the code is on the machine QA gave me to test with, but truncation is not working properly either (just like broken easter egg.) machine is https://192.168.51.98:8888/

See attached screenshot.
truncation is not working on euca software loaded on https://192.168.51.98:8888/

I wonder when that code was updated. I'll see if I can figure out, but devs
generally point to that CLC, not use the proxy running on it.



On Sat, Dec 8, 2012 at 12:38 PM, Jenny Loza (JIRA) <

Jenny,
You've used UI that was last time updated on Oct 23. Please use fresh version.

I figured that was the problem, since the code was fine when I reviewed it before.  [~viglesias] Can I just move this ticket back to In QA? And I need a newer system to check on than the one you sent me to on Friday please.

this *REALLY* breaks on instance landing. 

Should try and fix for 3.4 if we can. 

Attaching 3.4 screenshots from testing branch.

[~jloza]: I'm seeing fairly normal table layout with a long key pair string, tested with latest Chrome stable on Mac OS 10.8.  However, I noticed the table cells are vertical-align: middle.  We should probably change that to vertical-align: top, a simple one-line change which I've captured in the latest two before/after screenshots attached.  

Lemme know what your thoughts are on w.r.t. the alignment issue and whether or not we should bump up the min-width size on the key pair column (and perhaps others?).
[~jloza]: Also, we won't see that borked layout in your 10/4 screenshot now that the long instance name column is wrapping.  Referring again to my latest two attached screenshots.
[~jloza]: Setting you as the reviewer to reply to my latest comment and screenshots.

[~kgill], yes please top align. Thanks!

Things do look fixed w/r/t KP name and SG column with instance name wrap fix. Thanks!
assigning to you for top align, please.
Looks top aligned
